title: Using 3 bits to represent an integer then trying to store 8

content.question: A computer program uses 3 bits to represent integers. When the program adds the decimal (base 10) numbers 5 and 3, the result is 0. Which of the following is the best explanation for the result?

choices.label: The result was affected by lossy data compression.
The result was approximated by a floating-point representation.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and correct errors in algorithms and programs, including error discovery through testing.
